definition: to defeat/to damage/to lose (to an opponent)/to fail/to wither

sentences.english: This was a recognizable disaster to the German Air Force.
sentences.chinese: 这对德国空军来说是一次明显的惨败。

sentences.english: Mondale ended up losing the election in a landslide to Ronald Reagan.
sentences.chinese: 蒙代尔最后惨败给里根。

sentences.english: The debacle of the 2009 elections sharpened their scepticism.
sentences.chinese: 而2009年选举的惨败，更加重了他们的怀疑。

sentences.english: Some say the regressive lurch occurred because Americans lost confidence in government.
sentences.chinese: 有人说倒退的惨败是因为美国人失去了对政府的信任。

sentences.english: For the Americans studied Kasserine Pass even more intently than the Germans.
sentences.chinese: 美国人对凯瑟琳山口惨败的研究要比德国人认真的多。

sentences.english: This fiasco confirmed Kennedy's impression of Phoumi's singular incompetence.
sentences.chinese: 这次惨败更加坚定了肯尼迪认为富米毫无能力的看法。

sentences.english: After I got beat he asked me to come on anyway.
sentences.chinese: 在我竞选惨败之后，他还是邀请了我。

sentences.english: Why the internet industry---the so called "core of new economy"---suffered such a punishing defeat in China?
sentences.chinese: 为什么号称新经济核心的网络产业在中国如此惨败？

sentences.english: After a disastrous first half the team fought back to win.
sentences.chinese: 该队在上半场惨败后重整旗鼓反败为胜。

sentences.english: We were massacred in the final.
Ep506 - Wuji loses to Shuibo at the election.
sentences.chinese: 戊己在选举渔会理事会会长上惨败给水波。

sentences.english: Her first flop was Shanghai Surprise.
sentences.chinese: 她的首部惨败之作是《上海惊情》。

sentences.english: I felt like a loser, a major loser.
sentences.chinese: 我就像一个败者，一个遭受惨败的人。

sentences.english: The terrible defeat has shaken the army morale.
sentences.chinese: 那次惨败动摇了这支部队的士气。

sentences.english: The host team was clobbered in last night's game.
sentences.chinese: 东道主队在昨晚的比赛中惨败。

sentences.english: Chelsea recaptured the Premier League title in emphatic fashion as Wigan Athletic were thrashed at Stamford Bridge.
sentences.chinese: 切尔西强势上场，重获英超冠军头衔，维根竞技惨败。

definition: (literary) to be routed (in a war)/to suffer defeat (in sports etc)
to defeat/to inflict a defeat on sb
to lose to (sb)/to be outdone by
to suffer a defeat/to fail/to fall behind
to defeat decisively/to win decisively/great victory/triumph
to lose a war/fig. the loser (in a competition or election)
to defeat/to damage/to lose (to an opponent)/to fail/to wither
